pattern.name: Percentile
pattern.description:
Percentile of a numerical attribute.
Note: The implementation for PostgreSQL is supported from PostgreSQL 9.4. Note: Schizofrenic window functions - PostgreSQL requires "group by", MSSQL requires "over".
pattern.example: The 95th percentile of the transaction amount. The advantage of the percentile in comparison to other aggregates like min, avg and max is the resistance to outliers. The disadvantage is increased
pattern.author: Jan Motl
pattern.code: SELECT @base , percentile_cont(@value) WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY @numericalColumn) AS @columnName FROM @propagatedTable GROUP BY @base
SELECT DISTINCT @base , percentile_cont(@value) WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY @numericalColumn) OVER (PARTITION BY @basePartitionBy) AS @columnName FROM @propagatedTable
